content.question: Data were collected on two variables, <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, to create a model to predict <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. A scatterplot of the collected data revealed a curved pattern with a possible cubic relationship (<math alttext="y equals a times x cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a constant) between the variables. Which of the following transformations would be most appropriate for creating linearity between the variables?

choices.label: Taking the cube of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
Taking the cube root of <math alttext="y " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

Taking the cube root of both <math alttext="y " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
Taking the log of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

Taking the log of both <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: Taking the log of both <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
